 Resets the preference caches.

Detailed Description

'Server' Preference related functions (some of them scan-related).

All the preference getter- functions for pseudo boolean values work in the same fashion. The static 'yes' value is initialized only the first time the function is called. If then preferences != NULL, the arglist is queried, otherwise the value keeps being or is resetted to -1. On subsequent calls where preferences != NULL, the arglist does not have to be queried anymore. Resetting this "cache"s is possible by calling preferences_reset_cache.

Definition in file preferences.c.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void preferences_reset_cache (  ) 

Resets the preference caches.

Subsequent calls to the pseudo-boolean preference getters will query a given arglist once and refill the caches.

Definition at line 444 of file preferences.c.

References preferences_benice(), preferences_log_plugins_at_load(), preferences_log_whole_attack(), preferences_optimize_test(), preferences_plugins_timeout(), and preferences_safe_checks_enabled().
